post_text: We love our teachers!
shared_text:
Moraga Education Foundation (MEF)
April 21 at 2:39 PM ·

LP’s third grade teacher Lindsay Garrity wanted to be a teacher since she was a child. She believes in the “whole child” approach to education, providing support to kids emotionally, as well as academically. “There is nothing more satisfying than seeing the look on a child’s face when they understand something for the first time, or when they know I will support them and have their back,” she says. Mrs. Garrity is working hard to implement distance learning in her classroom, and she appreciates the community support: “While this has been one of the strangest and most challenging years of my teaching career, it has definitely shone a light on the amazing support of the Moraga community.“ Thank you, Mrs. Garrity, for Making Moraga Brighter!￼ #thankyoumoragateachers #moragaeducation #lookingforwardtogettingbacktoschool #makingmoragabrighter
text:

post_text: The Moraga School District has a number of part-time job opportunities. MSD is looking for Intensive Instructional Assistants, a Night Custodian. Substitute Teachers, Childcare Aides, and Substitute Custodians. Please go to the website at www.moraga.k12.ca.us/hr for details on the various employment opportunities. Positions vary from 10 to 30 hours a week. If you have questions on any of the positions or would like to know how to become a Substitute Teacher, please contact Lisa Crouch at 924-377-4103 or lcrouch@moraga.k12.ca.us
shared_text:
MSD-CA.SCHOOLLOOP.COM
Job Opportunities
text:
The Moraga School District has a number of part-time job opportunities. MSD is looking for Intensive Instructional Assistants, a Night Custodian. Substitute Teachers, Childcare Aides, and Substitute Custodians. Please go to the website at www.moraga.k12.ca.us/hr for details on the various employment opportunities. Positions vary from 10 to 30 hours a week. If you have questions on any of the positions or would like to know how to become a Substitute Teacher, please contact Lisa Crouch at 924-377-4103 or lcrouch@moraga.k12.ca.us

post_text: Thank you Mrs. Gillbanks!👏🏻
shared_text:
Moraga Education Foundation (MEF)
October 2, 2019 at 3:26 PM ·

Comment below about how a librarian has impacted your or your child’s life!

The Rheem librarian, Mrs. Gillbanks, goes above and beyond to serve students, helping them find books at their level and with age-appropriate content (a task that can be challenging when the student’s reading level falls outside what is typical for their age). She loves finding the right books for kids, and often continues to give book recommendations to kids after they’ve graduated from Rheem! Mrs. Gillbanks also has requested to take her lunch break at a time that doesn’t coincide with the student lunch period so that she can be available to kids and keep the library open for students who want to spend their lunch break there. This unstructured time allows her to connect with students and provide them the support they need, both academically and socially.
Comment below about how a librarian has affected your or your child’s life!
text:
Thank you Mrs. Gillbanks!👏🏻

The Rheem librarian, Mrs. Gillbanks, goes above and beyond to serve students, helping them find books at their level and with age-appropriate content (a task that can be challenging when the student’s reading level falls outside what is typical for their age). She loves finding the right books for kids, and often continues to give book recommendations to kids after they’ve graduated from Rheem! Mrs. Gillbanks also has requested to take her lunch break at a time that doesn’t coincide with the student lunch period so that she can be available to kids and keep the library open for students who want to spend their lunch break there. This unstructured time allows her to connect with students and provide them the support they need, both academically and socially.

post_text: Way to go Lamorinda Community! Thank you for supporting our schools!
shared_text:
Moraga Education Foundation (MEF)
September 24, 2019 at 5:35 PM ·

You donated or pledged more than $240,000 on this year’s Day of Giving! These gifts bring the MEF Annual Giving Campaign total to over $800K, which is almost 30% of the $2.75M fundraising goal. Thank you! We still have a long way to go in this campaign, and you can help MEF reach its 2019-2020 goal by making a donation, pledge, or setting up a payment plan at moragaeducation.org
text:
Way to go Lamorinda Community! Thank you for supporting our schools!

Moraga Education Foundation (MEF)
September 24, 2019 at 5:35 PM ·

You donated or pledged more than $240,000 on this year’s Day of Giving! These gifts bring the MEF Annual Giving Campaign total to over $800K, which is almost 30% of the $2.75M fundraising goal. Thank you! We still have a long way to go in this campaign, and you can help MEF reach its 2019-2020 goal by making a donation, pledge, or setting up a payment plan at moragaeducation.org

post_text: The Moraga School District opens the 19/20 school year 8/13. Please plan extra travel time, drive safely and remember to not pass school buses when red lights are flashing.
